text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to William H. Wharton, April 24, 1829. An excellent statement of difficulties overcome in founding his settlements and of his vision of their future. The present administration in Mexico favors slavery. Immigration of 500 southern men of character would make Texas. Future of the cotton trade with England in return for "untariffed" English manufacturers.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="04-24-1829">April 24, 1829*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*W. H. Wharton*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dr. Sir, Relying on what you told me at the *location_mentioned*mill */location_mentioned*that you would call and see me before you left I expected you. You ought to have called. You and myself are almost *person_mentioned*strangers*/person_mentioned*, our personal intercourse has scarcely been sufficient to enable us mutually to estimate each other properly. I have a very decided friendship for all *person_mentioned*Col G. [Groce's friends?]*/person_mentioned* I have full confidence in *person_mentioned*League */person_mentioned*and he assures me that *person_mentioned*W. H. W.*/person_mentioned* is all that a man of honor and a firm and stedfast friend ought to be. My own disposition is frank open and confiding. But the experience of the last six years in settling this *location_mentioned*wilderness*/location_mentioned* and the unfavorable light in which human nature has been so often presented to me, has greatly weakened my genl confidence in mankind, it has however had the effect to make me cling the closer to the few who are really and substantially men. I now write under the conviction that you are of this class and shall therefore throw aside ceremony or reserve. I wish to see you permanently locate here. All that is now wanting in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*is a few more men in this *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*, not open mouthed *person_mentioned*politicians*/person_mentioned*, nor selfish visionary *person_mentioned*speculators*/person_mentioned*, nor jealous ambitious declamatory *person_mentioned*demegogues */person_mentioned*who will irritate the public mind by inflamitory criticisms about temporary evils and by indulging in vague surmises. We need *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*of enlightened judgment, disinterested prudence, and reflection, with a great stock of patience, unshaken perse verence and integrity of purpose. Men who will calmly put their shoulders to the wheel and toil for the good of others as well as for their own, and who will be contented to rise with the country without aimin[g] to force it forward prematurely to overtop the genl level of prosperity by undue individual advancement. A band of such men firmly linked together by the bonds of mutual confidence and unity of purpose and action could and would make *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*the *location_mentioned*garden of North America.*/location_mentioned* You know enough of the *person_mentioned*population */person_mentioned*here to be convinced that we lack men of this class I have in this respect stood almost alone. The fate of this *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*has so far rested pretty much upon my own resources, my own exertions and management. *person_mentioned*Councellors */person_mentioned*I have never had. When I began the whole *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*was a *location_mentioned*wilderness */location_mentioned*wholly destitute of resources, the Govt unsettled, the *person_mentioned*Mexicans */person_mentioned*genly very much prejudiced against*person_mentioned* North Amn*/person_mentioned* emigration and public opinion in the *location_mentioned*United States*/location_mentioned* most decidedly unfavorable both as to the real value of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, the character of the *person_mentioned*Mexican Govt */person_mentioned*and even as to the practicability of succeeding in forming any other kind of settlement here, than a nest of *person_mentioned*fugitives*/person_mentioned*. Such were the prospects under which I commenced. They were so discouraging that all my *person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned* united in trying to persuade me by argument and ridicule and by every other means to abandon the project.*/p*
*p*I myself believed that the probabilities of failure or success were almost equal, but I deemed the object worthy of the risk and I had confidence in myself. I foresaw that I must enlist myself as a kind of *person_mentioned*slave */person_mentioned*for years, that I must chain down all the impulses of a temperament naturally hasty and impetuous and sensitive to a fault; that I must patiently submit to toil injury and abuse and slander and misconstruction, sometimes bending and yielding to a degree that laid me liable to the imputation of weakness and at others resorting to measures that appeared arbitrary, or partial or whimsical; but to say all in a few words I had an ignorant, whimsical selfish and suspicious set of *person_mentioned*rulers */person_mentioned*over me to keep good natured, a perplexed and confused colonization law to execute, and an unruly set of *person_mentioned**location_mentioned*North American frontier*/location_mentioned* republicans*/person_mentioned* to controul who felt that they were sovereigns, for they knew that they were beyond the reach of the arm of Govt or of law, unless it pleased them to be contrould. To have been universally popular amongst the *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*for the first two or three years would have endangered all, for it would have excited vague jealousies in the point (?) alone that I was conciliating popular favor in order to wield it in a particular way. To have been universally unpopular endangered all in another way, for it would have totally destroyed that degree of popular confidence and character abroad which was necessary to draw emigration and it would also have deprived me of the power of controuling the *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*sufficiently to have prevented them from destroying themselves. I could not stoop to associate with the low *person_mentioned*drunkards */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*rabble */person_mentioned*and would not do it under any circumstances but very extreme ones. The reflecting and worthy part of the *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*have always adhered to me firmly throughout. The former class abused me over their grog and at times have had weight enough to require humoring and management to keep within bounds, but they effectually removed all suspicion that I was courting the favor of a *person_mentioned*rabble */person_mentioned*for the purpose of wielding it and in this they did me and the *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*a service though without knowing or intending it and I used their abuse of me to advance the public good and establish myself more firmly in the confidence of my *person_mentioned*rulers*/person_mentioned*. Added to all this I was poor, destitute of capital, and never was there an enterprise in which money was more necessary than in this one, I involved myself in pecuniary embarrassments to raise funds at the outset, but they were in no degree sufficient, and the good of the *person_mentioned*settlers*/person_mentioned*—in fact the salvation of the whole enterprise—compelled me to raise something out of the *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*themselves. This drew down upon me the imputation of being a *person_mentioned*speculator */person_mentioned*and curses and abuse followed. I did not suffer it to turn me aside from my duty to the *person_mentioned*settlers*/person_mentioned*. I used what I recd for the general good and am still as poor as ever except in land.*/p*
*p*There were but few *person_mentioned*men of capital*/person_mentioned* in the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and they were of a cast of intellect better qualified for cent pr cent calculations of present profit than for liberal and enlarged views for the future. All were greedy to sow largely under the expectation of reaping 1000 fold in a few years, but none were willing to contribute anything for the seed. It was considered that I must furnish all and do all and risk all. Thus it is that I had *person_mentioned*Scylla */person_mentioned*or *person_mentioned*Charybdis */person_mentioned* constantly in view for the first three or four years of my labor, and I have actually labored hard and dreadfully to build up the fortunes of men, many of whom were heaping abuse upon me. I have no ambition of a political military or avaricious character. My ambition has been to succeed in redeeming *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*from its *location_mentioned*wilderness*/location_mentioned* state by means of the plough alone, in spreading over it *location_mentioned*North American*/location_mentioned* population enterprise and intelligence, in doing this I hoped to make the fortune of thousands and my own amongst the rest. My success so far has fully equalled my expectation, and I think that I derived more satisfaction from the view of flourishing *location_mentioned*farms */location_mentioned*springing up in this *location_mentioned*wilderness */location_mentioned*than*person_mentioned* military or political chieftains*/person_mentioned* do from the retrospect of their victorious campains. My ambition is to build up, for the present as well as for future generations, to do it silently without ostentation or display. I deemed the object laudable and honorable and worthy the attention of honorable men. The *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*is now sufficiently advanced to offer inducements for emigrants of capital to flock to it. The allusions I have made as to the difficulties which have been surmounted added to your own observations while here, will enable you to form a pretty accurate estimate for the future and I think you will agree with me that we are leaving both *person_mentioned*Scylla */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Charybdis */person_mentioned*far astern and that there is nothing but plain sailing ahead.*/p*
*p*As I before said all we need is*person_mentioned* men of intelligence and capital*/person_mentioned* who can harmonize with each other, and a plenty of them, the more the better. Should such men in reply to your arguments in favor of their removal here say that they cannot bring their *person_mentioned*slaves*/person_mentioned*, you may safely tell them that they can bring them without any fears of being troubled (?). The men now in power in this *location_mentioned*state */location_mentioned*wish to tolerate slavery, and whether they wish it or not if *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*firmly and decidedly and prudently wills it so it will be for the voice of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* will not be disregarded. Should they say that our laws and constitution are defective, tell them that both can be amended and that the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*if united can and will amend them. Should they say that *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*is in a state of revolution and its Govt crumbling to pieces, tell them that we are *location_mentioned*1000 miles from the seat of revolution */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*separated from any adjoining state by an uninhabited and almost uninhabitable wilderness of 200 miles*/location_mentioned* and that all the adjoining states are thinly populated poor and nearly destitute of resources. Should they object to living under the *person_mentioned*Mexican */person_mentioned*Govt tell them that they will find it to be to their interests to be *person_mentioned*inhabitants of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* as *person_mentioned*Mexican citizens*/person_mentioned*. The policy of this Govt to emigrants is liberal beyond parallel. An immence coasting trade is open round the *location_mentioned*Gulf of Mexico*/location_mentioned* and to the *location_mentioned*West Indians,*/location_mentioned* and *location_mentioned*Europe */location_mentioned*will turn with joy and avidity from the " tarriffed cotton " of the*location_mentioned* U. S.*/location_mentioned* to the fine long staple of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*. The subject of the cotton trade has been laid before the national executive through various channels and the *person_mentioned*secretary of state*/person_mentioned* has informed me in reply to a communication I made on the subject *date_mentioned n="Fall - 1828">last fall*/date_mentioned* that the *person_mentioned*President */person_mentioned*would at a proper time call the attention of *person_mentioned*Congress */person_mentioned*particularly to it. He has already recommended a reduction of the tariff.*/p*
*p*You can also tell him that the *person_mentioned*Genl land Comr */person_mentioned*will shortly be here to distribute land and issue titles, and that this *date_mentioned n="Fall - 1829">fall */date_mentioned*is the great seed time. If they come in then they will most surely reap a bountiful harvest hereafter, but they must come "bag and baggage " *person_mentioned*wives */person_mentioned**person_mentioned*children */person_mentioned*and "plunder" for an actual removal is necessary to get a title. A great part of the *location_mentioned*coast of Texas*/location_mentioned* will be open for settlement this *date_mentioned n="Summer - 1829">summer */date_mentioned*and *date_mentioned n="Fall - 1829">fall*/date_mentioned*, including the *location_mentioned*shores of the fine bays of Galveston and Matagorda*/location_mentioned* and also the *location_mentioned*whole country up to the San Antonio road*/location_mentioned* in this and *location_mentioned*De Witt's colony*/location_mentioned*. Now then is the time. Let there be a strong population of *person_mentioned*North Americans*/person_mentioned* here, with a sufficient number of talented and virtuous and prudent *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*to direct them and who would oppress us? *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*? She lacks both the power and the inclination for it would be her interest to bind us to her. *location_mentioned*Spain */location_mentioned*? She cannot. *location_mentioned*England */location_mentioned*dare not for war with the *location_mentioned*U. S.*/location_mentioned* would of course be the result of the occupancy of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*by that power and the same applies to *location_mentioned*France*/location_mentioned*. What then have *person_mentioned*emigrants to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*to fear? If they harmonize with themselves and are prudent they have nothing to fear and they have everything that man desires to hope for and expect. Look back at the prospects when I commenced. What were they in comparison with the prospects now ? My standing with this *person_mentioned*Govt */person_mentioned*and with the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*generally is now established I think on a firm basis and I could do much to benefit *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*if there was a sufficient population here of the right kind, and if such a population would treat me with candor and confidence they could use me very much to their own advantage for I am not selfish. I will remain firm to this Govt so long as it stands and will lose my life sooner than betray in the slightest degree my oath as a *person_mentioned*citizen*/person_mentioned*. All the alterations that are needed in our laws I think can be constitutionally obtained without difficulty.*/p*
*p*If the *person_mentioned*Govt */person_mentioned*stands and prospers *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*must prosper under it. If the *person_mentioned*Govt */person_mentioned*falls the bonds which bind *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*will of course be severed by that fall, and in this event *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*can either unite herself to the *location_mentioned*North */location_mentioned*under the necessary guarantees from that Govt or become an independent speck in the *location_mentioned*galaxy of nations*/location_mentioned*. *location_mentioned*Europe*/location_mentioned* will gladly receive our cotton and sugar etc. on advantageous terms in exchange for " untariffed " manufactured articles. We should be too contempt able to excite the jealousy of the *location_mentioned*Northern Mammoth*/location_mentioned*, and policy and interest would induce *location_mentioned*Europe */location_mentioned*to let us alone. I deem it to be more than probable that the great powers would all unite in garanteeing the Independence of little *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, There are many powerful reasons why it would be to their interest to do it.*/p*
*p*Suppose that some 4 or 500 *person_mentioned*southern men*/person_mentioned* of talents and capital and high character were to emigrate to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*in a body *date_mentioned n="Fall - 1829">next fall*/date_mentioned*, what can prevent their future prosperity ? I have the legal right to garantee to them a reception as *person_mentioned*emigrants */person_mentioned*in my *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*and as such the law grants them land, The door is legally opened to them and they are invited to enter and partake of the fortune and prosperity and happiness which nature has provided with a liberal hand for all who will now advance and receive them. Such an opportunity never offered upon *location_mentioned*earth*/location_mentioned*, never can offer again, and it will be trifling with fortune to neglect it. But do not misunderstand me as to the kind of *person_mentioned*emigrants*/person_mentioned*—ardent inexperienced *person_mentioned*hot headed youths */person_mentioned*piping from *location_mentioned*college */location_mentioned*or ignorant self willed "mobish" *location_mentioned*mountaniers */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*frontiersmen */location_mentioned*who " hold to Lynch laws' and damning those who are in office merely because they are in office, would totally ruin us forever. We need that class of *person_mentioned*emigrants */person_mentioned*who deserve the appelation of *person_mentioned*southern Gentlemen*/person_mentioned*, whose fortunes are independent but not overgrown, whose judgment has been enlightened by education and matured by experience, and who have *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*to keep the intemperate wild ambitious passions of the human heart within the circle of prudence. I would fearlessly pledge my head that an emigration of 400 such men *date_mentioned n="Fall-1829">next fall*/date_mentioned* to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*would permanently ensure the prosperity of this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and the happiness of its *person_mentioned*inhabitants*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I have expressed myself to you with more freedom and frankness than is usual with me on subjects of this kind. It is not every *person_mentioned*man*/person_mentioned* whose mind is capable of embracing the past the present and the future and I have never sought celebrity by trying to confound the ignorant by matters which they could not comprehend. It is my request that this letter should be confidential and that it should not by any means be published. I cannot but think that if proper exertions were made a large company of *person_mentioned*Southern Gentlemen*/person_mentioned* from *location_mentioned*C. G. A. and T. [Carolina, Georgia, Alabama, and Tennessee?]*/location_mentioned* might be made up to emigrate here *date_mentioned n="Fall - 1829">next fall*/date_mentioned*. I am too poor in money to make the trip or I would have gone on with you. I wished to see you on this subject and regret that you did not call.*/p*
*p*[Stephen F. Austin.]*/p* */div1*
